definition: lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
to gnaw/to nibble/to bite
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write

sentences.english: I gotta go home and hit the books.
sentences.chinese: 我得回家用心啃書本去了。

sentences.english: It's no good talking to Tom; he's buried in his book again.
sentences.chinese: 和湯姆談話沒用，他又埋頭啃書了。

sentences.english: Generally speaking, I usually stay at home, hitting the books.
sentences.chinese: 一般來說，我通常都待在家裏啃書。

definition: all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world

definition: foolish talk/nonsense
grand dreams/unrealistic ideas (idiom)
to talk nonsense/to bullshit

keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
henpecked male

definition: see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion

half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
glutton/chowhound

to make fun of/to seek diversion
to ask a question, already knowing the answer
